result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Vilas County Clerk of Circuit Court

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devin M Prott

records.addlTxt:
2:31 PM Defendant Devin M Prott appeared by video, in custody from Iron County Jail in Michigan.  Attorney Scott H Lyon appeared by video for Devin M Prott.  Attorney Dennis Brown in court for State of Wisconsin. Defense confirms receipt of the information in this case. Waives reading. Not guilty pleas entered. Defense notes an error on the date filed with the criminal complaint and information. State will move amend offense date. Court asks that state to file an amended information. Pleas are still entered. Bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

3:21 PM Defendant Devin M Prott appeared by video, in custody with Iron County Jail in Michigan.  Attorney Scott H Lyon appeared by video for Devin M Prott.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Waiver of preliminary hearing.  Rights given.  Court finds defendant is making a knowing and voluntary waiver of right to preliminary examination.  Court finds probable cause.  Bound over for arraignment on an information.  Bond continued.
Arraignment scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

8:25 AM Defendant Devin M Prott appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Scott H Lyon appeared by video for Devin M Prott.  ADA Dennis Brown in court for State of Wisconsin. Court questions defendant on missing court date in August. Defendant Prott was in Iron County Jail.  Court quashes the warrant. Court re-instates cash bond with the same conditions. Defense confirms receipt of criminal complaint.  Waive reading. Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Defense's Request to Appear Remotely
